intro: Matelea phainops, commonly known as the goldenmatelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Matelea phainops typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
